category.term: 1742~Jack Kerouac~Kristen Stewart~On the Road~The Twilight Saga
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Jack Kerouac, meet Twihards.

The new adaptation of the legendary author's seminal novel, On the Road, is sending Twilight fans into a frenzy thanks to its new trailer, which heavily features the vampire franchise's leading lady, Kristen Stewart.

But the trailer makes it clear that Stewart is a long way from Forks. She plays Marylou, the free-spirited 16-year-old bride of Dean (Garrett Hedlund). The film, based on Kerouac's semi-autobiographical, iconic 1951 novel that launched the Beat generation, follows a group of restless and disenfranchised youths road-tripping from New York to the West coast and then back again.

The cast is rounded out by Sam Riley, Amy Adams, Viggo Mortensen, Kirsten Dunst, Steve Buscemi, Terrence Howard and Elisabeth Moss.

The film adapation of On the Road has a long and tortured history. Everyone from Marlon Bradon to Brad Pitt to Billy Crudup has been attached to star in it at one time or another, but it took director Walter Salles (who previously adapted The Motorcyle Diaries) to finally get the movie off the ground.

The film, which was shot partly in Montreal, is expected to premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in May.

Watch the trailer below:

source.title: Watch Kristen Stewart in the On The Road Trailer
source.subtitle: The first trailer for the big-screen adaptation of Jack Kerouac's seminal novel On The Road has surfaced.
